summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message delivered by Pastor Travis Hearn today! In this sermon about surrender, Pastor Travis challenges us to move from being merely 'surrounded' by Christianity to truly being 'surrendered' to Jesus Christ. Isn't it easy to go through the motions of faith without truly giving everything to God? PT cuts right to the heart of consumer Christianity - where we want God's blessings without commitment. He uses powerful illustrations like the monkey trapped by a coconut and the Dead Sea to show how we can become spiritually stagnant when we only take in, but never give out. The core message? Jesus didn't call us to just 'become Christians', but to fully follow Him by laying down our lives, our identities, our influences, and our incomes. Pastor Travis boldly declares that true discipleship means moving from being a 'pretender' to being fully 'surrendered'. The challenge is clear: are you just surrounding yourself with Christianity, or are you truly surrendering everything to Christ?
mainPoints: Move from being surrounded by Christianity to being surrendered to Christ
Reject consumer Christianity and become a true disciple
Throw down your identity, influence, and income at Jesus' feet

versesMentioned.text: Do not copy the behavior or the customs of this world, but let God transform you into a new person by changing the way you think.
This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us and we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.
If you cling to your life you will lose it; but if you give up your life you will find it.
But each person is tempted when he is lured and enticed by his own desire.
God asked Moses, 'What is in your hand?' and instructed him to throw down his staff.
Paul was bitten by a poisonous snake but shook it off into the fire and suffered no ill effects.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 37:5: 'Commit your way to the Lord; trust in him and he will do this.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas of life not fully surrendered to God
Monday.action: Create a personal 'surrender inventory'. List areas of your life where you're holding back from fully giving control to God. Reflect on why you're hesitant to surrender these areas.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the areas of my life where I'm still holding onto control. Give me the courage to truly surrender everything to You. Help me trust Your plan over my own. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Galatians 2:20: 'I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding what true surrender looks like
Tuesday.action: For one day, before making any decision, pause and ask: 'What would Jesus do in this situation?' Practice letting Christ's perspective guide your choices.
Tuesday.prayer: Jesus, help me die to my own desires and live fully for You. Let Your will be done in every aspect of my life today. Guide my thoughts, words, and actions. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 6:13: 'Do not offer any part of yourself to sin as an instrument of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God as those who have been brought from death to life.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one habitual behavior or thought pattern that doesn't align with God's will. Write it down and specifically pray for God's strength to overcome it.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, expose the areas where I'm still living according to my old nature. Give me strength to surrender these patterns and live in Your freedom. Transform me from the inside out. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Luke 9:23: 'Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me.'
Thursday.action: Do one intentional act of service or sacrifice today that requires you to put someone else's needs before your own. Reflect on how this feels.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me what it means to truly follow You. Help me lay down my comfort and convenience for Your purposes. Make me a vessel of Your love today. Amen.

Friday.scripture: James 4:7: 'Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.'
Friday.action: Create a personal 'temptation response plan'. Identify your typical temptation triggers and develop specific biblical strategies to respond when they arise.
Friday.prayer: God, I surrender my weaknesses to You. Give me wisdom to recognize temptation and strength to resist. Fill me with Your Holy Spirit and help me walk in victory. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Saturday.focus: Trusting God's plan through complete surrender
Saturday.action: Spend time journaling about your fears and uncertainties. Symbolically 'give' each worry to God, replacing fear with trust and prayer.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my fears, my plans, and my future to You. Help me trust that Your way is always best, even when I cannot see the full picture. Give me peace that surpasses understanding. Amen.
